Introduction

Microsoft is expanding availability of the Copilot Notebooks feature to younger users. Previously limited to users aged 18 and older, this update allows 13–17 year-olds with Microsoft 365 Copilot plans and Entra ID accounts to use Copilot Notebooks across supported platforms. 

This message is associated with Roadmap ID 510105.

When this will happen:

Rollout will begin mid-November 2025 and is expected to complete by late November 2025.

How this affects your organization:

  • Who is affected: Organizations with 13–17 year-old users (e.g., students) who have Microsoft 365 Copilot plans and Entra ID accounts.
  • What will happen:
    • Copilot Notebooks will become available to eligible 13–17 year-old users.
    • The feature will be accessible in the Microsoft 365 Copilot app and OneNote app across Web, Windows, Mac, iOS, iPadOS, and Android.
    • By default, the feature will be ON for all eligible users.
    • Existing admin policies will continue to apply.
    • Admins can restrict access using Cloud Policy.

What you can do to prepare:

  • Review and configure your organization’s Cloud Policy settings to manage access for younger users: Configure Copilot Notebooks access.
  • Communicate this change to helpdesk and education support staff.
  • Update internal documentation if you include guidance on Copilot Notebooks.

Compliance considerations:

No compliance considerations identified, review as appropriate for your organization.

Details.Value: Microsoft Copilot Notebooks will be available to 13–17 year-olds with Microsoft 365 Copilot plans and Entra ID accounts starting mid-November 2025. Title: Microsoft Copilot Notebooks will be available to 13-17 year-olds
